DOC.brief_summary: The rise in life expectancy implies an increased number of nonagenarian patients who need evaluation for critical lower limb ischaemia (CLI). The study goal is to evaluate whether revascularization techniques in these patients fulfill a set of security and efficacy criteria generated from surgical results in a validated historical cohort.
DOC.brief_title: Revascularization in Nonagenarian Patients With Critical Lower Limb Ischaemia
DOC.criteria: Patients suffering from Critical Limb Ischemia aged 90 yearold or above
